events.originalText: Head of a Bear (pictured) sold at auction in London for a total of £8.8 million, a record for a drawing by Leonardo da Vinci.
events.subtitle: Head of a Bear
events.headline: Leonardo da Vinci's 'Head of a Bear' sells for record £8.8 million in London auction

events.originalText: German citizen Lars Mittank disappeared from Varna Airport, Bulgaria; his last known movements have been widely watched on YouTube.
events.subtitle: Disappearance of Lars Mittank
events.headline: German citizen Lars Mittank disappears from Varna Airport in Bulgaria

events.originalText: Sudan Airways Flight 139 crashes near Port Sudan Airport during an emergency landing attempt, killing 116 of the 117 people on board.
events.subtitle: Sudan Airways Flight 139
events.headline: Sudan Airways Flight 139 crashes near Port Sudan Airport, 116 out of 117 on board killed

events.originalText: Upon the death of Kim Il-sung, Kim Jong-il (pictured) became the supreme leader of North Korea.
events.subtitle: Death and state funeral of Kim Il Sung
events.headline: Kim Jong-il becomes supreme leader of North Korea after Kim Il-sung's death

events.originalText: Aeroflot Flight 4225 crashes near Almaty International Airport in the Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic (present day Kazakhstan) killing all 166 people on board.
events.subtitle: Aeroflot Flight 4225
events.headline: Aeroflot Flight 4225 crashes near Almaty International Airport, all 166 on board killed

events.originalText: King Mwambutsa IV of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.
events.subtitle: Mwambutsa IV of Burundi
events.headline: King Mwambutsa IV of Burundi deposed by son Prince Charles Ndizi

events.originalText: Canadian Pacific Air Lines Flight 21 is destroyed by a bomb near 100 Mile House, Canada, killing 52.
events.subtitle: Canadian Pacific Air Lines Flight 21
events.headline: Canadian Pacific Air Lines Flight 21 destroyed by bomb, 52 killed

events.originalText: Following student protests at Rangoon University, Burmese general Ne Win ordered the demolition of the historic students' union building.
events.subtitle: 1962 Rangoon University protests
events.headline: Burmese general Ne Win orders demolition of historic students' union building after protests

events.originalText: Korean War: American troops withdrew from Cheonan, in modern-day South Korea, after suffering heavy casualties from a North Korean attack.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: American troops withdraw from Cheonan in South Korea after heavy casualties in Korean War

events.originalText: Following reports of the capture of a "flying disc" by U.S. Army Air Forces personnel near Roswell, New Mexico, the military stated that the crashed object was a conventional weather balloon.
events.subtitle: Roswell incident
events.headline: U.S. Army Air Forces state Roswell 'flying disc' was a weather balloon

events.originalText: The Mounties begin their March West, their first journey to the Canadian Prairies.
events.subtitle: Royal Canadian Mounted Police
events.headline: The Mounties begin their March West to Canadian Prairies

events.originalText: The United States Declaration of Independence received its first formal public reading, in Philadelphia.
events.subtitle: United States Declaration of Independence
events.headline: United States Declaration of Independence publicly read for the first time in Philadelphia

events.originalText: French and Indian War: French forces defeated the British at Fort Carillon on the shore of Lake Champlain in the British colony of New York.
events.subtitle: French and Indian War
events.headline: French forces defeat British at Fort Carillon in New York during French and Indian War

events.originalText: Great Northern War: Swedish forces under Charles XII were defeated by Russian troops led by Peter the Great at the Battle of Poltava.
events.subtitle: Great Northern War
events.headline: Russian troops defeat Swedish forces at Battle of Poltava in Great Northern War

events.originalText: Charles II of England granted the Rhode Island Royal Charter, described as the "grandest instrument of human liberty ever constructed", to the Baptist minister John Clarke.
events.subtitle: Charles II of England
events.headline: Charles II of England grants Rhode Island Royal Charter to Baptist minister John Clarke
